chapter.title: Deploying selfinstall images

abstract.para: The chapter describes deployment of &slema; from selfinstall pre-built images.

chapter.para: &productname; provides selfinstall iso images that enable you to deploy &slema; to your machine and then configure the system on the first boot.
To prepare the setup, you need two separate devices. One device (either a physical or a virtual drive) where &slema; will run, and another device that serves as a configuration medium.

To deploy the sellfinstall image, you need to prepare the configuration device as described in . The configuration device must be plugged to the host machine throughout the installation process. Then you need a disk with enough free space where &slema; will be deployed from the selfinstall iso.
After the first boot, you need to register your &slem; instance by using the transactional-update command. For details, refer to .
&slema; has available extension for live patching. To use this extension, you need to add the extension to your subscription from the installed system. For details, refer to .
